intro: Gomidesia candolleana, commonly known as the Candolleana gomide, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
